word: Sensitive and sympathetic--There are men, better, far better calculated to till the soil than to deal with human minds; they are not sensitive nor sympathetic.  Those who would do the best and highest service for Jesus Christ must copy the Pattern in all their associations in business deals, and in spiritual things.  God sees as men do not, the result of this hardness of heart toward one another and it is an offense to Him and dishonors His Holy Name.-Letter 16d, 1892, p. 3 (May 7, 1892, to Brother Haskell).
